intro: Bupleurum wittmannii, commonly known as the Wittmann's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets, giving it a delicate appearance. Bupleurum wittmannii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
